title: The Data Divide
story: In ML, we never test on data we trained on! The train-test split is fundamental - we train our model on one portion of data and test its performance on unseen data. This tells us if our model generalizes well or just memorized the training data.
instructions: Import numpy as np. Create array `data` with [10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80]. Split it: first 6 elements as `train_data`, last 2 as `test_data`. Calculate `train_size` and `test_size` (lengths). Print all four variables.
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np
data = np.array([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80])
train_data = data[:6]
test_data = data[6:]
train_size = len(train_data)
test_size = len(test_data)
print(train_data)
print(test_data)
print(train_size)
print(test_size)

tests.description: Should print train, test sets and sizes

hints.text: Use array slicing to split: [:6] for first 6, [6:] for remaining
